page.title: 15PLANT TECHNOLOGY CENTRE
page.content: Until 1983 there was a Nursery on the Hale-Woodgreen border selling plants and trees to the public. The Nursery was then sold and in its place there is now a Plant Technology Centre. The research work carried out there (tissue culture, hydroponics, genetics, etc.)is mainly concerned with trees. One of their main objectives is to grow certain trees in areas where they would not otherwise grow. In countries where deforestation has taken place on a large scale the firm is enlisted by the Government to plant large areas of trees, such as teak and mahogany.
